Work

Centuri Analytics
2015 - Present

As UI developer at Centuri Analytics, I have worked on a range of patient flow optimisation projects to develop innovative software solutions for different stages of the patient journey.

I have worked closely with senior consultants, nurses, finance specialists and process improvement managers to gather requirements, refine ideas and iterate quickly to produce software that enables more efficient department communication, enhances organisational capability, promotes patient safety, and increases compliance with department best practices.

My role at Centuri focuses on modern web application development with JavaScript and related technologies, but I also handle UX/UI design responsibilities, requirements gathering and QA for our patient flow management products, as well as delivering presentations to new and existing clients including senior consultants, business managers and C-Level hospital staff.

The first project I deployed with Centuri was LaminOS.ED, a Patient Flow Management System currently used by doctors, nurses and healthcare assistants to manage patients 24/7 in St. James's Hospital Emergency Department, one of the busiest Emergency Departments in Ireland.

In March 2017, the LaminOS.ED project was profiled by the Irish Times newspaper and recieved the cover feature of the midweek health supplement of the print edition.

About

This website presents work-related information about the author, Neil O'Carroll, as an informal CV for potential future employers, collaborators or business contacts. As I am a Humanâ„¢, there is more to me than just my academic credentials and employment history. Below are some quick notes on my hobbies, interests and background.

Bio

I grew up in Tralee, in the South West of Ireland, but I currently live and work in Dublin. I'm interested in technology, web, music, human languages and design. Before coming into the dev world, I worked as an English language teacher while also doing audio and music recording projects on the side.

Music

Much of my free time is spent writing, recording and performing music, sometimes on the guitar and sometimes using a computer.

I first became interested in development through dabbling in sound design for film and video games, and I try to find a few hours every week to make some fresh bleeps and bloops with Ableton Live or, more recently, the Sonic Pi - a really cool FOSS project for live coding music in Ruby.

Sports

To keep (somewhat) fit, I train at a kickboxing gym a few nights a week, and occassionally play 5-a-side football at the weekends.

Misc.
